titles.title: Cell Phone Service Disclosure Act of 2003
To amend the Communications Act of 1934 to require the Federal Communications Commission to monitor complaints regarding the quality of wireless telephone service.
Cell Phone Service Disclosure Act of 2003

action.text: Referred to the House Committee on Energy and Commerce.
Referred to the Subcommittee on Telecommunications and the Internet.

bill.summary: Cell Phone Service Disclosure Act of 2003 - Amends the Communications Act of 1934 to direct the Federal Communications Commission to: (1) establish and administer a system, including a toll-free telephone number, for registering complaints with regard to the quality or performance of commercial mobile telephone services; and (2) require each service provider to include in each subscriber's bill a statement informing the subscriber of such system.
